Parents,

The health department is an option for getting children’s immunizations to be ready ready for the school year. We are continuing to provide community services at curb side (older children). As we stated in the plan, updates may occur along the way during this pandemic. Today district and school leaders met to review updated state information and scenarios regarding the school year. Today - we have amended the school document with two changes.

1. School buildings will not open until 7:15 AM daily this year. The earliest car riders and bus riders can be dropped off at school will be 7:15 AM.

2. Students that chose either of the virtual options will be allowed to participate in extracurricular activities and sports "after school hours" (after 3 PM) but "not" during the school hours of the day.

LCHS Navy Cadet Corps Academic Team Place 2nd in Area and Top 10 Percent in Nationals - written by Sr. Chief Pitpitan

LCHS’s Navy Cadet Corps competed in the Navy JROTC National Academic Exams on March 10, 2020. The 75-question exam encompassed curriculum questions on general knowledge of naval sciences, cadet field manual, cadet drill manual, maritime history, and current events. Each team had 50 minutes to complete the proctored exam. LCHS entered three 5-person academic team to compete. Team # 3 made up of cadets Caleb Catlett, Tristan Davis, Dylan Myrick, Kacie Northrup, and Raymond Warden finished 2nd out of 118 teams in area competition. The team also placed 105th out of 1609 nationally and scored in the 93.47 percentile in the nation. Team # 1 made up of cadets Joshua Lyell, Bryson Schroeder, Gavrell Wingard, John Kurtz, and Stephen McKin finished 58 of 118 in area competition. In addition, Team # 2 made up of cadets Cody Bramlett, Keilee Camargo, Ana Escobar, Kylie Hastings, and Neven Longshore finished 69 of 118 in area competition.

post_text: Many teachers from Unity School have visited the Ron Clark Academy in Atlanta. They would like the opportunity to maximize our resources by creating a room that is designated for transformations. With this room, they would like to purchase room transformation supplies to create more themes that correlate with our lessons. Supplies may include manipulatives for hands-on activities, padlocks to create an Escape Room, flashlights for crime scene detective work, surgical masks and scrubs to dissect sentence parts, plastic tablecloths to decorate, lights to create different effects, etc. They would also like to purchase foldable tables and stackable chairs that could be used or stored away. They hope to enrich student learning while also creating a memorable experience with this hands-on, interactive approach. To help with this goal, you may click on the following link and view "Setting the Stage to Engage" at https://www.leanstreamrp.com/projects/21 #oneLC
